Package payrollObjects

Class Company

java.lang.Object
payrollObjects.Company
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
A container class that defines the abstract data type Company to hold the company list of employees and it's operations. This class is responsible for adding and removing employees to the company. It is also responsible for processing payments on the company payroll, searching for employees, sorting lists of the employee, printing lists of the earnings of employees, resizing the list of employees, and adjusting hours for part time employees.
Author:
Matthew Brandao, Armit Patel

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Company

      public Company()
      Creates an array of Employee with an initial capacity of four employees. Stores a counter for the amount of employees in the company.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Employee employee)
      Finds the index of the Employee that was passed to the method in the Company.
      Parameters:
      employee - reference to an instance of Employee
      Returns:
      array index position of the employee in the company list, -1 if not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the capacity of the company list by a size of four employees. Creates a new array and copies the elements from the old array while preserving the original sequence. The reference to the array of employees is passed to the new array.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Employee employee)
      Adds a new employee to the end of the company list and increments the employee counter. Invokes grow method if the company is full before adding the new employee.
      Parameters:
      employee - reference to an instance of an Employee
      Returns:
      true if the employee does not exist in the list, false if the employee already exists

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
      Removes an employee from the company list and decrements the employee counter. The elements are shifted to handle empty spaces in the company list. Does not alter the list if the employee does not exist in the company.
      Parameters:
      employee - reference to an instance of Employee to remove
      Returns:
      true if the employee was successfully removed, false if the employee does not exist

    • setHours

      public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
      Sets the working hours for a part time employee. Does not alter any data if the employee does not exist or the employee is not a part time employee.
      Parameters:
      employee - reference to instance of Employee with hours to set
      Returns:
      true if the employee exists and is an instance of Parttime, false if the employee does not exist or is not an instance of Parttime

    • processPayments

      public void processPayments()
      Process the payments for all employees in the company.

    • print

      public java.lang.String print()
      Prints the original list of employees in the company. If there are no employees present in the list it will output a warning.
      Returns:
      List of earnings statements as String

    • printByDepartment

      public java.lang.String printByDepartment()
      Sorts the list of employees present in the company by department in ascending order and prints the list of employees and their attributes in ascending order to the console. The list is sorted in-memory. If there are no employees present in the list it will not sort and instead it will output a warning.
      Returns:
      Earnings statements sorted by department as String.

    • printByDate

      public java.lang.String printByDate()
      Sorts the list of employees present in the company by date published in ascending order and prints the list of employees and their attributes in ascending order to the console. The list is sorted in-memory. If there are no employees present in the list it will not sort and instead it will output a warning.
      Returns:
      String of earnings statements sorted by date hired.

    • getList

      private java.lang.String getList()
      Helper function that prints the current list of company employees that are stored in-memory of the Company object.
      Returns:
      List of employees as String.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the company currently holds any employees.
      Returns:
      true if the company does not hold any employees, false if the company does hold employees

    • exportDatabase

      public void exportDatabase​(java.io.File targetFile) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      Opens file with PrintWriter and exports to Controller. Throws null pointer exception to handle case while process is interrupted.
      Parameters:
      targetFile - to be exported
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException
